001package _Delaunay;
002
003
004import java.awt.Color;
005import java.awt.Polygon;
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007import java.util.Arrays;
008import java.util.HashSet;
009import java.util.List;
010import java.util.Set;
011
012import ij.IJ;
013import ij.ImagePlus;
014import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
017import imagingbook.pub.geometry.delaunay.Triangle;
018import imagingbook.pub.geometry.delaunay.chew.Pnt;
019import imagingbook.pub.geometry.delaunay.chew.Triangle2D;
020import imagingbook.pub.geometry.delaunay.chew.TriangulationChew;
021
022
023
024
025/**
026 * TODO: NOT OPERATIONAL - UNFINISHED!!
027 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the calculation of of the 2D Voronoi diagram for
028 * a given set of points.
029 * 
030 * Requires a binary (grayscale) image with points valued &gt; 0.
031 * 
032 * This plugin is based on applet code by Paul Chew (http://www.cs.cornell.edu/home/chew/Delaunay.html)
033 * that is contained in the associated 'delaunay' package.
034 * Usage: Create or open an grayscale image containing a point set (any pixel with value &gt; 0 
035 * is considered a foreground point, zero pixels are considered background). The plugin 
036 * triangulates this point set and displays the triangulation as a new color image.
037 * 
038 * @author W. Burger
039 * @version 2020/03/09
040 */
041public class Voronoi_Demo_UNFINISHED implements PlugInFilter {
042        
043        static String title = "Voronoi diagram";
044        private static Color VoronoiColor = Color.blue;
045        private static Color PointColor = Color.magenta;
046        
047        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
048                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES;
049        }
050        
051        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
052//              int width = ip.getWidth();
053//              int height = ip.getHeight();
054                
055                List<Point> points = collectPoints(ip);
056                IJ.log("Found " + points.size() + " image points.");
057                
058                TriangulationChew dt = new TriangulationChew(points);
059                                
060                ImageProcessor cp = ip.convertToColorProcessor();
061                
062                // draw the Delaunay triangulation
063                cp.setColor(VoronoiColor);
064                drawVoronoiDiagram(dt, cp);
065
066        // draw the original point set
067                cp.setColor(PointColor);
068                for (Point pnt : points) {
069                        draw(pnt, cp);
070                }
071                
072                (new ImagePlus(title, cp)).show();
073        }
074        
075        // ----------------------------------------------------------
076
077        // TODO: NEEDS CLEANUP!
078        private void drawVoronoiDiagram (TriangulationChew dt, ImageProcessor ip) {
079        // Keep track of sites done; no drawing for initial triangles sites
080        Point[] initPoints = dt.getSuperTriangle().getPoints();
081        Set<Point> processed = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(initPoints));
082        for (Triangle triangle : dt.getTriangles()) {
083                Triangle2D tr2D = toTriangle2D(triangle);
084                for (Point p : triangle.getPoints()) {
085                        if (!processed.contains(p)) {
086                                processed.add(p);
087                                List<Triangle2D> triangles = dt.surroundingTriangles(toPnt(p), tr2D); //surroundingTriangles(pnt, triangle);
088                                List<Pnt> vertices = new ArrayList<>(triangles.size());
089                                for (Triangle2D tri : triangles) {
090                                        Pnt center = tri.getCircumcenter();
091                                        vertices.add(center);
092                                }
093                                draw(vertices.toArray(new Point[0]), ip);
094                        }
095                }
096        }
097    }
098        
099        // ---------------- REPLACE THESE --------------------
100        
101        Pnt toPnt(Point p) {
102                return new Pnt(p.getX(), p.getY());
103        }
104        
105        Triangle2D toTriangle2D(Triangle t) {
106                return new Triangle2D(t.getPoints());
107        }
108        
109        // ----------------------------------------------------------
110        
111        private List<Point> collectPoints(ImageProcessor ip) {
112                List<Point> vertices = new ArrayList<>();
113                int M = ip.getWidth();
114                int N = ip.getHeight();
115                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
116                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
117                                float val = ip.getPixelValue(u, v);
118                                if (val > 0) {
119                                        vertices.add(new Point.Imp(u, v));
120                                }
121                        }
122                }
123                return vertices;
124        }
125        
126        private void draw(Point[] vertices, ImageProcessor ip) {
127        int[] x = new int[vertices.length];
128        int[] y = new int[vertices.length];
129        for (int i = 0; i < vertices.length; i++) {
130            x[i] = (int) Math.round(vertices[i].getX());
131            y[i] = (int) Math.round(vertices[i].getY());
132        }
133        Polygon poly = new Polygon(x, y, vertices.length);
134        ip.drawPolygon(poly);
135    }
136        
137        private void draw(Point p, ImageProcessor ip) {
138                int x = (int) Math.round(p.getX());
139                int y = (int) Math.round(p.getY());
140                ip.drawRect(x - 1, y - 1, 3, 3);
141        }
142        
143}
